titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Sponsored Programs, Grant records
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Sponsored Programs, Grant records FA1328

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-13 17:45:33 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Sponsored Programs, Grant records

physdesc.extent: 11 letter document boxes and 1 half-letter document box.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In March 1960 an Office of the Registrar was established to maintain records of faculty and students. This was a function which to this date had been handled by the Dean of Students and through the Office of the President. Earlier records of the scientific staff had been kept in the Office of the Business Manager. The first appointment to the position of Registrar was Marian Lucius who resigned in June 1972.

The functions of the office developed as it became an adjunct to the Office of the President. Reports to the New York State Education Department were made from this office. Various statistical data on institutional facilities, such as the library; the number of degrees granted; subjects and rank of instructional staff were filed through this office to be reported to the State Department of Education. When a program of state-aid to non-public institutions of higher education was established required reports were made each year.
After the resignation of Marian Lucius, Phyllis Viets was appointed and served to June 1974.

Antonia Siddiqi, from the Office of the President, took charge of the funtions of the Office of Faculty and Student records in addition to her work on the Grant Proposals and Grant Programs of the various laboratories. In 1979 Antonia Siddiqi became Secretary to the Board of Trustees as well as Director of the Office of Sponsored Programs with Eleanor Gibson handling much of the routine of Faculty and Student records.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains early grants, grants made for construction in new laboratory space or new health research facilties, as well as institutional grants made for trainee or post-doctural fellowships, and grants made to support research of a scientist(s).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Primarily arranged alphabetically by the name of the scientist receiving the grant, with early grants generally arranged in sequence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of the RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Summaries and listings of pending and unexpected grant balances. Includes correspondence with the Bursar and the Business Manager.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between the Business Manager and D. W. Bronk and the National Science Foundation (NSF). Includes June 1964 statement from NSF clarifying possible conflicts of interest for NSF Board Members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NSF grants 1959-1960. Plans and proposals for completion of laboratory space in the South Laboratory. Correspondence is between F. Brink, Alan Waterman and Douglas Whitaker.
